div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1745 Khinisly environs, Shemakha raion, Azerbaidzhan, in anc. Albania, 1958 Burial: 50-25 B.C. (Pakhomov) Contents: 330+ AR. Found with AR objects and ingots Imit. Alexander III: 72 dr. Lysimachus: 3 post. tetradr. (Byzantium ) Athens: 5-6 New Style tetradr. Mithradates VI, Pontus: 1 tetradr. Nicomedes II: 2 tetradr. Nicomedes III: 5 tetradr. Antiochus IV: 2 tetradr. Demetrius I: 9 tetradr. Alexander I Bala: 1 tetradr. Antiochus VII: 53 tetradr. Alexander II: 1 tetradr. Antiochus VIII: 1 tetradr. Seleucus VI: 1 tetradr. Antiochus X: 1 tetradr. Philip I: 15 tetradr. Mithradates I, Parthia: 1 dr. (as Sellwood 8-10) Mithradates II: 104 dr. (as Sellwood 27) "Gotarzes I": 5 dr. (as Sellwood 30) Sinatruces: 18 dr. (as Sellwood 31) Phraates III: 7 dr. Phraates III?: 27 dr. Roman Rep.: 1 den. (C. Licinius L. F. Macer) Disposition: Baku 217; Tiflis to; Regional Mus., Shemakha 7; private coll. 48 Pakhomov, Trudy Gosudarstvennogo muzeia istorii Azerbaidzhana 5 (Baku, 1962), pp. 74-6; Voprosy istorii Kavkazskoi Albanii (Baku, 1962), pp. 107-10 Kropotkin, no. 1540 â€ Pakhomov, IX, no. 2080 Crawford, RRCH, no. 246 The description of the coins is that of Pakhomov
